title: Ohm Overlooked
description: Georg Ohm’s father was a locksmith, a background that may have given his son practical experience that was useful to his future electrical research. While pragmatically useful, Georg’s relationship with his father was uneasy: when his father discovered that the young man spent his time at the University of Erlangen dancing, ice-skating and playing billiards, rather than studying, he forced his son to leave his studies.
